website_summaries.verdict: The Momentus XT is an excellent replacement for traditional laptop hard drives. It offers large capacities and SSD-like performance at a fraction of the cost.
pros: The Seagate Momentus XT offers excellent performance at a price that's significantly lower than solid state drives (SSDs)
It offers a larger capacity than SSDs and comes with a generous five-year warranty
cons: When compared with traditional hard drives, the Momentus XT is more expensive and currently caps at 500GB
The drive doesn't support the new SATA 6Gbps data transfer rate

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED (05/10/19):  Harddrive DIED.
customer_reviews.text: UDPATED: This is not the third Seagate Harddrive that has crashed or quit working installed in the PS4 and PS4Pro. I will never buy these again. Luckily, Amazon was gracious enough to refund my money even though it was way past the return date. Just saying, Buyer Beware. ORIGINAL: Bought this to upgrade my First Gen PS3s 40 gig hard drive. Worked like a charm. Loaded right up and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: RedmondIvy

customer_reviews.title: 8 years later and it is dead
customer_reviews.text: Yes, you read correctly, 8 years ago I installed this drive in my home server that runs 24x7. Two days ago it stopped working. Drive inaccessible. SMART shows no errors and Windows recognizes the drive, but it cannot read from it. Salvaging some of my files as we speak and I won't go hybrid again.
customer_reviews.author: Trailman

customer_reviews.title: Slowly gets faster
customer_reviews.text: Hard drive prices seem to finally be returning to normal following 2011 supply disruptions, so I decided to upgrade mythat I use as a hackintosh. I replaced my main HD with this unit, and I moved it to. The improvement from my main system HD was modest, but then it started getting faster! That's the way the SSD cache in this unit is designed to perform, and it's made boot times and app load times quicker. It's also big and quiet, which is also a plus. It's also one of the last drives without the new larger sectors, which can be a boon for compatibility. All in all, I couldn't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Shane O. Laake

customer_reviews.title: momentus xt 500gb
customer_reviews.text: Was fast once it learned usage patterns, started throwing smart errors after about 1 year of use plus im not sure the drive i received wasn't a customer return or previously used part from someones system
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Crow

customer_reviews.title: Very noticeable performance improvement
customer_reviews.text: I installed the Seagate Momentus XT on my Lenovo T510 (Intel i7 Quad Core processor) and ran the PCmark system suite test before and after the installation. I also ran all of my frequently used applications to "train" the drive's tuning algorithm prior to running the PCmark tests. The comparison was made between a standard Seagate 7200 RPM drive and the Seagate Momentus XT. There were clearly noticeable improvements particularly for the data intensive applications. The PCMark score jumped from 6909 to 7657 (11% improvements) and the HDD General Usage score jumped from 6.9 Mb/s to a whooping 18.6 Mb/s (170% improvements !). The drive also runs very quiet. In my opinion, it is an excellent upgrade for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Momentus XT 500 GB 2.5 " SSHD ST95005620AS
customer_reviews.text: Purchased, as this drive allows a much speedier read/write and is just below a full SSD (they need to drop the prices a bit for the equal SSD). Quite and runs fairly cool. Good value for money. Do need to use SEAGATE'S tech support as no instructions in the box on how to format or partition this drive- little different to a regular drive- this is a 7,200 rpm unit not a 5,400 rpm version (suggest the 7,200 rpm version). Good help from them. Also bought a 750 GB version for an external drive, have three drives on my HP 8760W Workstation- 2 x 500 GB and 1 x 320 GB SSHD's and no problems once in and formatted/partitioned.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff D, NH.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Late 2008 MacBook Pro MBP running Mountain Lion 10.8
customer_reviews.text: Many Mac users are having problems with newer drives if their computers use a certain NVIDIA chipset - this especially affects late 2008 and early 2009 MacBook Pro models (they link up at SATA I speeds even though they are rated for SATA II speeds). I had a problem with a OCZ SSD and a SanDisk SSD, but this hybrid Seagate SSD works perfectly. If you are worried that your older MacBook Pro will not be compatible with a certain HD, don't be. This HD is a safe buy - I've had a lot of problems with other drives but this one worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in July 2012 for my HP laptop. Easy/straightforward installation, and no issues in over 6 years of use! Durable, and for $90. UPDATE 3/2020: have this HD for (8) years and still works great. Doesn't quite compare to current technology, but work mentioning the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: not impressed with durability at all
customer_reviews.text: My first one started failing after 5 months..."end to end errors" showed in smartmontools, then my computer had 2 devastating crashes from which I was barely able to recover with my Windows 7 recovery disc. Seagate's warranty replacemant process did send me a new drive before I had to send my old one back...that was nice. However, now 6 months later, the replacement drive is failing and has started making a soft bumping/clicking sound. Very disappointing! I had used Seagate drives through the 2000s w/o issues. I thought they were the best. Maybe that's not the case anymore. see blog,backblaze,com/2014/01/21/what-hard-drive-should-i-buy/
customer_reviews.author: RamblerSyndicate

customer_reviews.title: Dead after almost 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally review things online but I really have to do this one. Purchased my drive on 2/27/12. About a month ago, the drive stared to get read errors. I ignored it thinking it could be the file itself. Last week, my laptop couldn't see the drive anymore. Tried to mount the drive on my external drive so at least I can get my files out, nope. Like another poster here commented, I'm skipping the failed customer service. Getting another drive from another brand. Good luck all.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: almost 2 months without issue
customer_reviews.text: So seagate customer support will not even respond without an error code which a hard drive that loses power will not give. Just had a seagate replica 1.5 tb drive from costco doa as well. This hard drive worked great for 2 months, then the hp dv7 I put it into would randomly turn off. I pulled the hd after trying to run hp diags (ram and hd checks) from bios but no go (computer would halt and reboot). I placed this drive in 2 external enclosures and it would keep turing off mid file transfer after 30 minutes or so. The drive finally stayed on long enough to clone the hard drive after putting it into a nexstar case.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C

customer_reviews.title: Own 5 of these
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased five of these over the past 12 months and have them in everything from a desktop to a net book. in a Nutshell: 1. no problems with malfunctions or any thing funky with programs. 2.Speed is decent and is a compromise between a solid state drive and a regular hardrive. -I have tried all three using same computer and identically cloned operating system for windows 7 and ubuntu. Essentially the Hitachi is about the halfway mark between the SSD and a regular 7200 rpm hard drive. 3. cost was the driving factor for my choice as I am waiting for SSD's to come down in price. 4. its a good deal for 99$ and change Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Chefsquare

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable difference in speed or efficiency.
customer_reviews.text: My original hard drive just crashed and it was not due to a virus. I will never purchase another Dell for myself or family member. First the battery died and the replacement cost more than current computers on the market and then the hard drive gives out. So a portable desktop is what I currently own. No battery life whatsoever to go it alone. Either my computer (Dell) does not like this drive or I did not install it correctly. I noticed no increase in speed. I am going to take my computer in for service and see if with a proper audit and corrections if I can update this review to meet the hype of this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does your laptop need a new lease on life?
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive to replace the conventional HDD on an older Macbook Pro that had become almost unusable after accumulating 4+ years of clutter. After making the switch and a relatively short clone operation, the laptop felt much faster. This hybrid drive far outperformed the conventional drive it replaced. I've had at least three of these SSHD drives from Seagate. I used several to similarly restored life to other Mac that were several years old, and added one to a Mini to boost both capacity and performance. These are good products for instantly increasing the perceived speed of your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fusion

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement
customer_reviews.text: I got this drive for my daughter's after her internal 320gb croaked on her MBP 13", I already had the 750gb momentus xt and was very pleased. The upgrade was so smooth . I duplicated Pre-installed Snow Leopard with her appls from a USB bootable Snow install. Then used carbon copy cloner to duplicate that partition, then restored her files from her Home Dir. VOILA, The drive shows some improvements in load and access v/s a traditional 7200rpm.....and the price is right. Next upgrade a 256gb SSD in combination with the hybrid XT in a optical bay enclosure. Would highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Serge A.

customer_reviews.title: ITX HTPC
customer_reviews.text: So, I was curious... Didn't want to use benches for "adaptive memory" because they aren't built to test that. I usually put an SSD (boot and app)and then a large platter in my builds. The question....'Is this an economical substitute for this?' I cloned over a standard 3.5 drive to the XT. Ran it fairly hard for a month....and saw little or no performance upgrade. My previous dealings with Seagate drives leaves me weary of them....however this one is still working well. No trouble yet, but again I don't see any advantage. Keep in mind that I am rating this drive for use in ITX HTPC uses....not laptops. Update: been a year and it functions exactly as it did new.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my fiancee's laptop because we had planned on upgrading her RAM and HDD before we dive into Windows 8. Not wanting to deal with cloning Windows or buying a full copy of Windows 8 (we opted for the upgrade) I had this extra SSHD laying around. I thought about selling it on eBay or Craigslist, but I said, "What the hey" lets throw it in the PS3. And I did just that. The PS3 has shown signs of improvement on Skyrim (it's now playable) and even though I don't notice it really, I "feel" like it's making my PS3 faster. In my head or not, it doesn't matter. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Vahdyx

customer_reviews.title: Quick, but just a little vibe
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed the XT into my 13" MacBook Pro, replacing the 320 gig factory disk. I noticed increased vibration as soon as I fired the machine up. Not enough to be bothersome, just enough to notice. The original drive Apple shipped with the machine (like all their machines) is dead quiet. After using the new drive for just a couple of hours I timed a boot up and was shocked. What used to take about 65 - 75 seconds now only takes 30 - 35!!! I have also noticed apps launch much faster. The hybrid stuff really works. I knocked off one star for the minor vibration, but I love this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: These hybrid drives are pretty impressive. I bought two of them to replace some normal spinning hard drives I had when I wanted an upgrade but couldn't spring the extra cash for completely solid state drives. I would have expected a 50% increase in read times compared to what a SSD would give me. But when I benchmarked it compared to another computer that does have SSDs, I was seeing close to 90% of the performance increase. Amazing considering the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Momentus XT 500GB  laptop hybrid drive.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very quick, 3 days. Was used. Drive was formatted and clean. Could not tell it from new. Packed very well, static bag and stuffing. Nice! I own 6 of these. They all installed in desktops. They run in anything as long as AHCI is a option of the BIOS of your computer. A little faster than the common drive without the price of a SSD. This found a home in a new addition of mine, a Asus P5P43TD Pro motherboard, powered by a Intel Q9505 processor, Zigmatek cooler, 8GB of Crucial memory, Asus 6450 graphics, and a Antec 550W power supply.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Constant Freezing, Not Good!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good hard drive. On the Seagate forums, there are a lot of negative reviews talking about all the flaws. This hard drive make a lot of noise and it definitely didn't make computer and better or faster. There are so many problems with this drive, they were supposed to be fixed in the firmware updates, but the updates don't help. If you want a freezing, noisy, non usable hard drive, then go ahead and buy it. If you want a hard drive that works and that doesn't keep you awake during your sleep, then don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Improves the performance.  I had to upgrade the firmware.
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade the firmware. Took it in and out of service on my Dell laptop, but the other disks that replaced this had the same problems. So I just back it up. And because I have, I have recovered. Modern Windows (7 and above) operating systems really do beat the crap out of disks. I am convinced that Windows really does need a desktop and a 3.5 inch disk. So initially I blamed the disk, but no longer, and it is back in the Dell because it performs well enough to make it perform in an OK manner.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great for the average user
customer_reviews.text: This is not designed to be the best out there but it's pretty good for its price. For a hard drive not meant for gaming it does pretty well for MMORPG games and even fast paced first person shooters. This is used on a 2007/2008 acer laptop for casual use, school work, and gaming. In the few months my significant other has had it it has performed well. If you're looking for top of line, high speed, huge memory filled hard drive this isn't for you, but if you are looking for a good performance all around average hard drive for a decent price this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fail on 2nd boot up
customer_reviews.text: Cloned the 500gig source to the 500gig Momentus. XP. Machine started, did some work. Then rebooted and got stuck at Windows splash screen. Had to turn off the machine. Could never get past the splash screen. Stuck the original drive back in and got normal boot first time. Something is funky in this Momentus drive. Called Seagate. They were not answering the phone in the middle of the business day. Tried chat. Not answering chat in the middle of the day, either. No responses to my emails. So, drive goes back to Amazon as defective drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: The "hybrid" side of the hard drive never really works. I mean it's supposed to have circuitry on board that moves the most commonly used files to the solid state drive. But, I could never tell. Not to mention... it's only 32Gb. While that's plenty for a boot partition, you can't actually move files there yourself. What's the point? It's still slow. If you want cheap, get a regular hard drive. If you want fast, get a solid state drive. This compromise is none at all.
customer_reviews.author: DrSammy

customer_reviews.title: Good, fast, but make sure to have a backup.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, I own three of them. However, I have had 1 of them fail. They sent me a refurbished replacement. Overall, the speed difference is pretty awesome. Booting is much faster without the cost or loss of space you find with most currently available true solid state drives. However, its not a flat speed increase like a normal solid state. Just on the things you use the most. But I really like the drives overall, I'm just a little concerned about their life-spans after 1 of them failed.
customer_reviews.author: Ash6s

customer_reviews.title: Speed of a Solid State Drive (SSD) with the size of a regular hard drive (HDD)..
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this drive and it was well worth the money. A typical user only has so many files that they actually use on a regular basis. The drive moves those files to the SSD portion to speed up on the operation of your computer. The drive was really easy to use and setup in my desktop. I getting ready to purchase another one for my laptop. Some of the drive use SATA II while new computers use SATA III. Check what your computer has before buying either no reason to pay for the more expensive SATA III if your computer can only handle SATA II.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ramage

customer_reviews.title: A definate improvement - GREAT IMPROVEMENT
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these units in my HP G62 computer. It has made my system run MUCH better. It boots in less than 30 seconds instead of a minute plus. This unit comes with the latest firmware available which eliminates much of the issues reported on this drive by older reviews. If I am transferring lots of large files it is not a whole lot faster but that is where the 7200 RPM comes in. Boot and email are a great improvement. This is a great buy at around $100. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: JB Stoltzfus

customer_reviews.title: Sped my laptop up tremendously.
customer_reviews.text: My boot time was cut from a minute and a half to just under twenty seconds. All my applications open instantly, when there used to be a couple seconds of lag, and Adobe Photoshop opens instantly when it used to take about 15-25 seconds. From what I understand, this HD caches your most used applications to the 4 gigs of Solid State portion of the space. It worked wonders for me. I imagine it isn't quite as fast as a true SSD, but the price gap isn't worth the small amount of difference. The drive is considerably quieter than the factory drive that came with my iCore 3 Toshiba laptop, and noticeably faster.
customer_reviews.author: Loch Ness Monser

customer_reviews.title: SSD performance, SATA space, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Pro: 1. Best "disk" performance I've seen short of full SSD solutions. 2. Good size. 3. Moderate price in light of 1 & 2. Con: 1. One of the pair (setup as a mirror, fortunately) expired shortly after the Return period and I'm having the devil's own time reaching the Amazon partner (Platinum Micro, Inc.) to arrange warranty replacement. That wipes out all the Pro items. Can't recommend the disk or the vendor at this point. An excellent price/performance product marred by poor reliability and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney G.

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: A Seagate rep suggested this drive would be faster than a 500 GB SATA 3 drive as the boot drive on my desktop. It is not. Lack of SATA 3 probably hurts it there. I ended up using one of the 2 I bought in a laptop, replacing a 5400 rpm drive. That was a small improvement. I then put the other one in a mac mini, but found it was not noticeably faster than the 7200 rpm drive I had installed a few years ago (and was a lot of work to get it in there as well<G>). Disappointed sums up my feelings on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Townsend

customer_reviews.title: I love this hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. It is small, so I don’t need a hard drive bay and it boots in seconds. All I did was restart it around five times(so it would use it for its cache-like system) after I installed Windows. It’s been great and hasn’t given me any problems.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Fast Drive
customer_reviews.text: My 2006 Sony Vaio S660 (running XP) is slow compared to one of my 2012 models so I thought I would give this drive a try. I cloned my old drive to this new one using free EASEUS backup/cloning program. My boot time was cut by 2/3 and all the programs open much faster. The firmware is SD28 which is the latest. The price paid ($70.00) on Amazon was an excellent price. The drive is quiet although appears to run hotter but still acceptable. I have only used this drive a few days so time will tell about durability.
customer_reviews.author: tbirdvet

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice For VMs
customer_reviews.text: This drive is the developers answer for a reliable external HD that has performance and reliability and a great price. You can get Oracle Virtual Box and then create your VHDs and they will work blazing fast even when used externally. The secret is the transfer speed, the SATA cable and the high read-write speed thats magnitudes faster than IDE and USB. Don't hesitate if you are looking for a storage device. I've used these for two years now and no issues. IMPORTANT - Just make sure to get good quality cables and drive covers. Those will protect your HD from vibration, moisture and damage.
customer_reviews.author: feisal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product four Month's Later! Make sure to look for firmware updates!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is running excellent! I have a Macbook Pro 2008 and when I first got the hard-drive it had a few bugs with the sd25 firmware. Most of the issues stemmed from the new Lion OS operating systems. The fans would overrun, shutdowns were slow (sometimes I had to do a hard shutdown), it seemed at boot-up that the extra 4GB of ram in the harddrive did not even exist, and the drive would run extremely hot lowering battery time. But the update to sd28 fixed all these issues! Now it is running nice and smooth! Goto the main seagate site for firmware updates.
customer_reviews.author: Eric King

customer_reviews.title: interesting
customer_reviews.text: got this along with a 250 ssd.curious about the hybrid aspect.like its brother it was a snap to set up.i wanted to put in an old HP laptop(XP)i knew it would not fit in the bay,but wondered how it would work as an external.it appears to function(won't boot however)it comes on as a dual drive setup. there may be a speed increase with the stuff on the ssd.i got it to monkey around with.it resides in the external case i got when i purchased it.case is great & cheap.
customer_reviews.author: frog96

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat the speed for the investment
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife's Macbook pro 13" as her machine was a little sluggish. Wow, what a difference this made. The machine is much snappier and responsive. Boot time is quicker as is the launch time of the apps she uses all the time. I think if this had an 8gb option it would be perfect, as it's easy to go past the 4gb "cache". I liked this drive so much I put it in my workstation at home running Windows and Ubuntu. Also made a big difference there over a 10krpm sata drive. It's much more quiet of course but the speed bump is killer for the $100.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nederhorst

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for a MacBook
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in a Late 2009 model MacBook last year, and it has been running fine ever since. Under the Mac OS I had installed at the time (10.6), boot time went to about TEN SECONDS from power on to login screen. Unfortuantely, the upgrade to 10.7 and now 10.8 increases the boot time to well over 30 seconds. I can only imagine how much slower that might be on a standard hard drive. No issues, so far. It was definately a singifianct boot time improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: this is what regular hdd's should be
customer_reviews.text: If your not ready for the small sized ssd era, than go with this. It is definitely faster than any standard hdd, and won't let you down. For the average person, the newer xt won't make any difference. Either will be faster, but this is half the cost. You can't beat the size/price ratio on these. Booting on my pc was cut down by at least 20-30 seconds. The programs you use most often load much quicker as well. If you need a new hdd, than get this, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Razer

customer_reviews.title: Product good, description not so good
customer_reviews.text: I received the disk drive on time, but what they had described as a bare drive was more bare than I expected. After a trip to a local store I installed the drive with no difficulty and moved everything to the new disk. The increase in speed was beyond what I expected, and the noise level is excellent. If you are replacing an existing drive and want to transfer of your old drive to the contents the new drive get a kit to help you do that. In fact I would suggest to Amazon to have that option on the page.
customer_reviews.author: cabin bound

customer_reviews.title: Good drive but a little outdated.
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing a crashed drive on an older computer so I got this one to replace my current one and put my current one in the old computer. This drive seems to be faster and quieter, but I don't think it conserves that much energy compared to a slower spindle. The drive doesn't seem to spin down as much as it could. Perhaps with a few more GB of flash, it would spin down more often. The newer drives have more flash on board but I haven't tested them.
customer_reviews.author: Pihmpdaddi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hardrive!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the single best piece of hardware I have ever purchased for any computer. My start up boot times along with shut down times have improved by over 600% on average! My 1-year old Toshiba laptop died and after much research I chose this one. Is EXCELLENT! Easy to install, east data transfer and as always, you can't go wrong with Amazon !! BUY THIS SEAGATE DRIVE or choose the larger and even faster 750 GB version! You will love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: BLG

customer_reviews.title: Great performance upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Noticeable faster then my eco 5400 drive that was in my laptop. Quiet. Cool running. Quick start up. No more read/seek hesitations on computer from drive spinning up after parking for 'eco' savings'. Great value as a performance upgrade. I wish I had done this earlier. The flash memory allows faster boot times, while the 7200 give better read write performance. With a 9 cell battery upgrade, laptop is really nice to use away from the plug.
customer_reviews.author: tinman

customer_reviews.title: Zippy & Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: As the title i gave this review states, I'll add, so far, stable and quick. I originally bought this drive as a secondary to my M9750 Alienware laptop. Then decided to give it a fair test and made it the primary hard drive. Glad i did, cause it made that much of an impression. It's quick and quiet. Faster than the older, lesser Seagate hard drive that came with the laptop. So far a good buy as I'll be testing it thoroughly as i load it up with graphic and video editing programs and then try some new graphic intensive games on it.
customer_reviews.author: WiLL

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting SSD speeds when I ordered this to replace the 7200rpm mechanical drive in my ThinkPad T61 but I did expect a bit more performance than I've experienced. While my boot time is slightly faster and Outlook is a bit more responsive I'm not certain the premium over a mechanical drive is justified. The bottom line is that the drive appears to work exactly as advertised, but next time I'm looking for performance I'll purchase an actual SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great speed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hybrid drive as an upgrade for my girlfriends laptop. Not wanting to spend a ton of money on an ssd I figured I would go for a hybrid. I was pleasantly surprised by how fast the drive actually was. It increased the speed of the computer by almost 10 times. I am extremely impressed and I highly recommend hybrid drives as alternatives to ssd's until the prices of ssd's drop.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I installed this in an older (early 2008) iMac, and I did not see any improvement in performance over the 7200 rpm drive I had in it. I wish that I had bought a 60 gb SSD and used a regular 7200 rpm drive for storage with an optical drive slot adapter. To make matters worse, it died within a year. Put me off hybrid drives altogether. Will never ever buy another.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Snappy drive. Fast startup
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. I replaced the 5400 RPM drive that came in my 15" MacBook Pro. This drive, after a few days use, was noticeably faster. Startup takes about 1/4 of the time that it used to and my most used apps all launch much faster. As mentioned on the Seagate website, once the drive has had a chance to "learn" your habits and copy your most used items to the SSD, it becomes noticeably faster. So far, after a month of use, I have no complaints. Even the firmware update was painless. I would highly recommend this hybrid drive for anyone looking for more speed without the cost of a full SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: It use to be a good hybrid drive
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review. I have replaced this drive several months ago due to drastic degrade in performance. The "hybrid" on this drive I believe is a joke. It becomes a regular HDD after several months. If it is advertised at a good price, go ahead and buy. If not, I wouldn't recommend it. If you want a true increase in performance, buy a REAL Solid-State Drive, and if you need extra storage there is plenty of portable external storage available on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Xpendable

customer_reviews.title: Speedy hardrive
customer_reviews.text: Placed into a 2008 iMac. Performance is far superior to original equipment. The 4GB flash memory opens programs quickly. Safari opens before the icon can bounce once. Booting is much quicker than before. This is a great drive. Can not comment at this point on reliability, but have not seen this called out by other people. Based on performance I am seriously considering changing out the hard drive in my MacBook Pro to this one even though my current drive is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cycleman99

customer_reviews.title: reliable device  from a brand name manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive storage device has functioned properly since it was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Luikens

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: For the money they are the way to go to get faster load times on often used applications. So, if you are always loading IE9, then it will load very quickly. They include a "small" amount of solid state memory that is essentially read-only and is based upon your application usage activity. Any saving to disk is not made to the solid state memory. If you want really fast read and writes, then by all means get a SSD but for substantially more money.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Great on a Mac Book Pro 13'' - (late 2010)
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new Mac Book Pro 13'' - (late 2010), and I always wondered if a 7200RPM hard drive could have been resulted in temperature raise on a 13'' device. Also, many reviews affirmed that vibrations were terrible... Most of all is not possible to buy a 7200RPM for a Mac Book 13'' on the Apple Store.... By the way, when the Seagate Hybrid was introduced I decided to give it a try.......: IT IS THE BEST CHOICE!!! I totally love it, and it performs great on my mac...! No temperature issues, no vibrations at all!!!! It boots in less than 30sec and applications load much faster (photoshop take 6sec, transmit 1sec) Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Patrix

customer_reviews.title: very fast boot times
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed with the performance of this drive in my older laptop. Boot times are much faster as well as applications that I frequently use load quickly too. The price has dropped since I bought it and I'd buy another if I had other computers that needed drives. If I had a desktop computer, I'd just use a normal SSD with regular drives for data, but this is a great blend of the two for a laptop when I can only have one drive.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Nice fast HD/SSD hybrids, pricey still.
customer_reviews.text: These drives are faster than the 7200RPM hard-drive only options I've used by a fair margin, the main downside being they're not that much less expensive than a 128GB-256GB SSD. It you need to store a lot of data (if storage is more the question than raw speed) retaining good performance, these are a good solution. If you just need just performance, naturally a "pure SSD" will still be somewhat faster.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Grate Drive....
customer_reviews.text: This is a Grate update to my computer, i still havent seen to much change on the performance i guess is because my old drive was also 7200 rpm...I dont know how long it takes for the 4gb of ssd to work. I receive my drive with the SD26 installed its been working good. One thing all desktop user should know is that you will need a bracket to hold the 2.5 drive. I didnt know that so i will have to buy it its $7 usd not a big problem.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Trevino S

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Good performance
customer_reviews.text: I got this hybrid drive about a month ago - to replace the traditional 120gb SATA 2.5" disk in my aging laptop. It has certainly made a big difference. Besides having a huge capacity (500gb / 465gb formatted NTFS), the 4Gb of flash cache seems to have really sped up my boot time. It used to take between 3-5 minutes to get to a state where the machine was usable. Now it's up and running in about 1.5 min. Apps don't really launch or run faster, but boot time certainly improved.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Momentus XT 500 Well Worthwhile
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Seagate Momentus XT 500 Drive as a replacement drive for a Seagate Momentus 7200.3 320 GB drive on my Thinkpad laptop. There is very little difference between these drives besides the extra space and the flash memory cache. Although I wanted the extra room, I was not prepared for the substantial increase in performance. My laptop (Thinkpad) is used as a mobile workstation with a lot of CAD and graphic programs, so I'm constantly pushing the computer's capability. The small additional cost of the hybrid drive turned out to be one of the best things I could do.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Good at the time, not worth it now
customer_reviews.text: These were very interesting drives when they first came out. Storage and speed! Oh yeah, they occasionally ate people's data. I never had that issue, but still. Now, you can get an SSD of about half the size for about the same price. Much better deal, as the SSD will be much faster, and fewer worries about reliability. You can probably live with fewer cat videos in exchange for the speed boost of a real SSD.
customer_reviews.author: K and B

customer_reviews.title: Known Defect
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these drives and use two in a Dell T3500 Workstation in my office. About every three months one of the drives fail and I get an RMA from Seagate. In between the 4-6 weeks of waiting for the replacement I pop the spare drive in. I have three separate fans inside the machine and airflow and heat are not the issue. Seagate is aware of the defect and told me so.... I am moving onto Intel or Kingston SSD drives today.
customer_reviews.author: botics

customer_reviews.title: Very good hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this drive for about 2 weeks. I did have some difficulty getting it to work on my Windows 7 based computer. I had to use a variety of disk to format it and get Windows 7 loaded on it. Once the OS was loaded, the performance improved immediately. It seems that the drive is working harder than a regular drive. My laptop fan is always on with this drive. Overall I am satisfied with the performance improvement but if I had to buy another drive I would go with a conventional drive. If my fan is always on that means this drive runs hot and that is the last thing you need in a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: PcFix

customer_reviews.title: Fast but vibrates
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to upgrade an existing 240GB 5,200 RPM drive in my Aluminum MacBook. Installation was easy and the drive is fast and quiet. The only downside has been that it vibrates. I can't discern any difference in battery life, and it is nice to get the extra performance and capacity. The drive came with old firmware, so I upgraded first thing. Some people have had problems with older firmware releases.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Almy

customer_reviews.title: Drive Makes Noise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive to replace the one that came with my Dell XPS laptop which was getting old. The hard drive worked fined although I didn't see any improvement in the startup speed which it supposedly does via the hybrid solid state feature. The main problem with the drive however is that it makes a noticable (and irritating) clicking sound during use. Recommendation: Save your money and get a standard drive - the benefits of the hybrid are probably tiny if any, and most name-brand hard drives run completely silently.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing drive for the money
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the factory 500GB 7200RPM hard drive in my Macbook Pro running OS X 10.6 with this drive. The performance improvement in application load times is nothing short of amazing. Applications that used to take ten seconds or more to load now take only one or two. I didn't notice any significant improvement in boot time however the time to log in from when the OS prompts for a password until the desktop is loaded and usable was much faster. I would highly recommend purchasing this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ean J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Truly the best of both worlds.  Fast performance and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: This drastically improved the boot time on my laptop, and programs you most commonly use will load very fast with this drive. Well worth the money for an upgrade that will make a noticeable difference in performance. Even the files you rarely use load fast being that it is also a 7200 rpm drive with a fast internal throughput rating. I highly recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I'd hoped to notice an increase in boot speed after installing it, but, of course, it's using the solid state section for the most frequently accessed programs, and there's no way to just assign something to that sector. So, a couple of games have a super fast load time, which is fine. Physical installation was a breeze, OS install was as easy as Windows ever is, and it's taken to dual booting to Mint just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Irregular Joe

customer_reviews.title: Speed Monster
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Quad core computer & wanted a fast drive. This replaced a Hitachi 300gig drive in my computer & I seen the speed boost immediately. After a few boot ups my laptop is very fast now & also with all my programs. This is an awesome buy ! I cant wait till all our drives are 100% SD & are 1TB or larger and affordable. "Our technology" has been held back from us for way too long.
customer_reviews.author: TheEdge

customer_reviews.title: Have reasonable expectations
customer_reviews.text: My ratings might be higher than someone else maybe. You might expect lightning performance for the extra bucks that you pay. That's not what i was expecting for when I bought this. I just didn't want to buy a plain old 7200 RPM disk for about 50-60$ but didn't want to spend over 300$ for a top end SSD. Even the top end SSDs don't have the big hard disk sizes; like over 500GB. Didn't mind paying a little more. The performance has been better than an ordinary 7200 RPM disk. Boot times are pretty decent and overall performance even when running virtual machines is quite good. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. S. Shihabdeen

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I was fortunate enough to see this item on sale for $50 when it had been recently released. So I bought 3! Can't be 3 for the price of 1. These are very quick compared to stock hard drives that would be in your laptop. The size is perfect for the normal user. I would recommend this product if you are able to get it on sale. I don't know if I would pay $150 for just one though
customer_reviews.author: J-Mart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hard drive lasting much better than the original that came in the Macbook Pro. Giving years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Eric Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my PS3. It works great. It fits just fine and the PS3 Super slim knew I had installed it and copied the internal flash (12Gig) directly to the HD so now I have room to install more than one game. It does seem to flop around inside the PS3 bay but thats totally the fault of the PS3. There is nothing that came with my PS3 to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rook

customer_reviews.title: great drive, fast!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my fathers older 160gb laptop drive with this drive 500gb Hybrid drive. OS load was good, software was added. I rebooted a few times and loaded typical applications and you could tell it was getting faster and faster. A few months in and there is still lots of room left, bootup times are much shorter... now if I could just get my parents off DSL and onto cable internet!
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how fast my PC boots
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this (250GB) drive, my Windows 7 Home Premium install can go from powered off to browsing Firefox in less than three minutes. The drive runs pretty cool as well, though I suppose it'd need to since it's a laptop drive. And because it's only 2.5", there's room on the bracket I bought for a second 2.5" drive in the same bay as this one. I only wish I'd spent the extra few bucks to grab the 500GB variant in the first place...
customer_reviews.author: hi there

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: Hey I bought this for a little boost in speed and higher capacity but was surprised to see how fast it drained my battery. I have a 2010 Macbook Pro and this drive took my average battery life down from 6 hours to about 4.5 when using it for daily internet stuff: Facebook, watching video's streaming. I haven't noticed a life changing amount of speed increase, and it takes a lot of juice when its working hard. It's a good drive if your laptops plugged in all the time, but if you travel a lot with your laptop then get something more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace the standard 250 GB HDD that came with my Macbook Aluminum Late 2008 as 250 GB simply wasn't enough for my use, e.g. storing RAW photos. Compared to the standard HDD, I'd say that my applications and the Mac OS X loads faster. I've used it with image management programs like Aperture and I have to say that Aperture loads faster on the Momentus XT 500 GB than on the stock 250 GB that came with the Macbook.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Lim

customer_reviews.title: I dropped this SDD into my 2011 MacBook Pro and ...
customer_reviews.text: I dropped this SDD into my 2011 MacBook Pro and, with some help from an OWC toolkit, saw tremendously improved performance. Alas, battery life suffered, although I suspect that stemmed from the lingering hard drive (which I'd shifted to the optical bay) and Mac OS not knowing to to deal with the hardware change-up.
customer_reviews.author: Eston Melton

customer_reviews.title: Fast but noticeably Nosier !
customer_reviews.text: I did apply the Latest firmware update SD25 on a freshly built Snow leopard. It has been now over a month and below are my review: Pro: 1) Fast Cons: 1) Noticeably Nosier ! 2) Runs a little hotter Overall, i'm happy but not that excited...since i don't run lots of Apps or do any serious Video edit or photos... I'd give it 7.5 OUT OF 10
customer_reviews.author: Snowland

customer_reviews.title: Tech has been out for a while and still a great product.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to upgrade from an aged laptop drive and cant afford a true sdd, this is the perfect drive for you. Ive had a few of these drives since seagate first released them and it has never failed me. Ive also replaced a few friends laptop drives with these and they have had no issues what so ever. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: salmmon

customer_reviews.title: excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: 320Gb Seagate drive on my laptop was failing. Bought a SATA external drive enclosure and (free) Seagate Disk Wizard to clone onto this new drive. Performance is excellent. Only issue is I get drive temperature warning (free Acronis Disk Monitor) but that's probably because its in a thin laptop that has insufficient cooling when the graphics processor is working hard. No disk errors or failures encountered, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Page

customer_reviews.title: Second one!
customer_reviews.text: These hard drives work so well, this is the second one I have bought. Both of them for Playstation 3's. After purchasing mine earlier this year and raving about it's performance, I convinced my Uncle to have one put in his Playstation. They are a good, solid, reliable hard drive and will increase the performance of whatever you put them in. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: I'm Loving It
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive installed for about a month now and am very pleased with it. It's very stable, and just as fast as expected. It has noticeably shortened my boot up time and definitely performs well running my sometimes demanding software (Adobe CS5, Autodesk Products, etc.). I'd definitely recommend it to others and am considering looking for something similar for my custom built desktop.
customer_reviews.author: SRealm

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine In PS3 Slim
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace the stock HDD in my PS3 slim as 119 GB of the 120 GB were used and the setup was quick and simple(only needing a screw driver and a flash drive to load the drivers/updates from the playstation website) . Drive was noticeably quicker on setup and continues to be faster Now a year and 4 months later, although lately it's noticeably noisier , sometimes being picked up through my headset while playing online
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Tavarez

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit a Lenovo X220
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this product to replace the flaky HDD on my Lenovo X220. Turns out it does not fit in the bay in the laptop because it's 9.5mm thick. The X220 only takes a 7mm thick 2.5" hard disk :(. Moral of the story - please check your laptop's current hard disk size (or specs), and buy this only if your laptop supports a 9.5 mm thick drive. The hard drive itself seems fine - the copy of about 400 GB of data took around 3 hours using thecable - which I thought was quite reasonable. I now need to figure out what to do with the hard disk, but that's my problem I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Nimish Gupta

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my PC...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the 1TB drive that came with PC with this solid state drive. I moved the 1TB drive to another slot and use it as a back up. There is a noticeable difference in boot-up speed and in frequently used programs. This review comes after about two years of experience with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: LDG

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement laptop drive.
customer_reviews.text: It pooped out after not a very long time of use. It was one of the first hybrid SSD's so maybe they are making them better now. It was very fast in response time when it worked -- it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders for our older laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Our Toshiba laptop is a bit long in the tooth, but a new 512MB Momentus drive gave it back some of its original spunk. It boots into Window 8 very quickly now, and fires up Quicken and Chrome as if it were a new laptop. Got it on sale, but it is a FAR cheaper solution than going full SSD for this capacity, and gave us plenty of bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Longrower

customer_reviews.title: Great New Hybrid Drive
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent and rewarding purchase despite what I was told by early critics. I replaced my stock 5400 rpm hard drive with the hybrid on my i7 Macbook Pro. The new drive has been clearly faster, especially when first booting the machine, and completely unproblematic. It was simply a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Katz

customer_reviews.title: awesome drive for Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: i got this for my late 2010 macbook pro. this thing works awesome. Had to use DiskUtillity to format this thing properly at first but once installed Mac OSX performs awesome on this. Way faster than my old Seagate 7200 rpm drive, to me after using it for a day the ssd component seems to make a difference. Heard some bad reviews out there for this but for me seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: ALK

customer_reviews.title: No Problems (Macbook Pro 5,5)
customer_reviews.text: I've had absolutely no problems with this hybrid SSD/spindle drive. I know of all the various problems users faced as documented on Seagate's forums. There is a publicly shared Google Docs spreadsheet there with everyone's input (including mine). I haven't faced any problems whatsoever, and I'm glad of that. Honestly, I didn't know of the problems until after I purchased this. Feel sorry for those who have agonized with this drive. Firmware running is SD25 (as shipped). There is updated firmware, but I am not touching it since it works just fine. No need to break something that's working.
customer_reviews.author: mister2d

customer_reviews.title: Fast & quiet, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded the HD of my mid-2010 Macbook Pro with this. The installation was easy and once in, this thing was QUIET. A huge difference versus the stock HD that constantly made noises. It did speed up over time and with increased use as promised. I've seen sold my Macbook Pro but I was extremely happy with this hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sorab

customer_reviews.title: No Problems, Fast Drive
customer_reviews.text: My Mac Mini came with a small stock 5400rpm drive that was always filling up easily so i was elated to replace it. This drive is not loud at all even though its 7200 rpm. Very snappy (not blazing fast). Reboot time went from 1:40 to 30sec flat after about 5-6 restarts. Excellent price for the product as well. Came with the latest firmware & after about a month no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Maharaj

customer_reviews.title: New Life for an Old Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 13" Apple MacBook (2007) after the original harddrive filled up. Installation was easy and the computer runs better than ever. I can definitely tell a diffrence on the programs we use often- they start up very quickly compared to before. For 10% of the replacement cost I feel like we got a new computer.
customer_reviews.author: T. Storm

customer_reviews.title: Nice fast little drives
customer_reviews.text: Definitely saw a good speed increase and it's still going strong. I ended up replacing it with the 1GB version and putting this in an external enclosure. I use an SDD for my OS and somethings that require the extra speed and use the Momentus for Data storage. The two drives communicate very well and very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: thelastpiece

customer_reviews.title: fasssttttt
customer_reviews.text: this hybrid will definitely revive your PC or desktop (if you have a conversion kit to mount) - not as fast as a tru SSD but definitely faster than any mechanical HDD except your 10k whiners (which I simply can't listen to in any PC case) - priced right under $90 this 500gb is a quick buy and reliable as can be
customer_reviews.author: jackbnimble

customer_reviews.title: I wish it did what the description says it does
customer_reviews.text: Others have written about the drive hanging up. Word, of all programs, was slowed considerably when i installed this drive. Hate to return it but have to. This happened to me on a Lenovo i7 chipped T510 with 8 GB of RAM. The firmware upgrade won't work on mine so it should be the latest version. Hate to return it but have to.
customer_reviews.author: Hermosa Writer

customer_reviews.title: Macbook Pro 13in mid 2012 (non retina)
customer_reviews.text: i like that its affordable and fast but I'm had a sleep/wake issue just now.. hopefully i don't have a defective unit. but ill most likely buy an sad and put this in a super drive hdd adapter and have 2 drives (macbook pro mid 2012) 13in
customer_reviews.author: Telly Beaster

customer_reviews.title: Nice price and works well
customer_reviews.text: Install was easy in MBP 2010 -- I used Carbon Copy to clone drive 1st, then took apart my Mac with Ifixit. It booted right away -- slightly faster than 7200 Scorpio Black -- and has gotten faster with use. Not SSD fast -- not even close, but the speed increase for most programs is noticeable. Came with firmware 28 -- no problems after 3weeks -- slight hum noticed at times, but no vibrations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Brady

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought two
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drive. I upgraded my Alienware M15x, and after a few reboots, everything (not just the reboot) seemed to be super fast. It was working out so well that I upgraded my M11X as well, and that has been great too. I definitely recommend this drive . . . I also upgradd the firmware right after installation which could be why I havent run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bolivar

customer_reviews.title: Hard drive works nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of the Hybrid drives, and I've used 2 of these particular model drives without any issues whatsoever. I think it about the best thing you can get without going to a SSD (Solid State Drive). The nice thing about this drive is you get the performance, but also you get the larger storage space of the traditional hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ortgiesen

customer_reviews.title: Slick, smooth, simple.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this device as a replacement for an AlienWare M14xA1 after a total system crash. The drive works, mounted, system detected it right away, and partitioning a Unix/Windows 7 device went flawlessly. There's no real noticable performace increase from this being a hybrid HDD/SSD vs. your standard HDD. Overall, good drive, it works, but nothing super impressive about it. So, 4/5. For those of you browsing through reading comments, don't let my comments scare you out of a drive. It's cheap, efficient, and I'd buy it again. But, there's nothing about it that blew me away enough to give it a "perfect" review. Experience: 3+ years as a state employed IT.
customer_reviews.author: Kinslayer722

product_meta.title: Seagate Momentus XT 500 GB 2.5 Inch Solid State Hybrid Drive ST95005620AS
product_meta.description:
Capacity:500 GBThe Seagate Momentus XT drive offers hybrid storage with Adaptive Memory technology, enabling the drive to deliver higher capacities up to 500 GB and SSD-like performance. The Momentus XT drive is designed for all standard laptop PCs and is OS-, driver- and software independent, making this drive easy to integrate and easy to use. Adaptive Memory technology enables the drive to tailor its performance to the user. Whether you are gaming, editing digital media or crunching numbers, the performance is optimized and ready for your next move. Adaptive Memory technology is a Seagate data management technique that constantly monitors and quickly recalls data usage and preferences. It places files and data that the user will likely access again and again into the solid state portion of the drive. When the user requires the data or application file, it already sits in an instantly accessible location, thereby customizing system performance for the user. Constant monitoring dynamically improves overall response time based on personal usage. You can perform at your best no matter how you use your laptop PC.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


SEAGATE MOMENTUS XT SOLID STATE HYBRID DRIVE
SPEEDY, SPACIOUS, AND EASY TO OWN
Get the Seagate Solid State Hybrid Drive and supercharge your laptop. SSHD combines the blazing performance of a solid state drive and the huge capacity of a hard disk, all with a budget-friendly price-tag. The Seagate SSHD is compatible with virtually any laptop computer, any OS, and any application, so you get plug-and-play, revved-up performance from any system.

The Seagate Solid State Hybrid Drive boots in seconds, not minutes PERFORMS LIKE A SOLID STATE DRIVE
The Seagate Solid State Hybrid Drive boots in seconds, not minutes. SSHD revs up your machine for peak performance (up to 4x faster than 5400 RPM hard drives). Plus, it gets faster as it gets to know you: NAND flash memory and Adaptive Memory technology work together to learn your specific use patterns and continually optimize your performance.

Play, create and store as much digital content as you want; up to 750 GB in capacity STORE MORE, WITHOUT COMPROMISE
Never sacrifice capacity for performance again. Have it all with a Seagate Solid State Hybrid Drive, where killer performance meets massive storage. Whether you're into gaming, HD video, photography or music--SSHD lets you play, create, and store as much digital content as you want, up to 750GB. It all adds up to the storage you demand with the performance you crave in an easy-to-install package.

Simple to install, simple to run while simply saving your bottom line BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK
The smart money is on the Seagate Solid State Hard Drive. No other drive costs less while delivering as much. Seagate SSHD costs just slightly more than a traditional hard drive, yet delivers dramatically improved performance--without compromising on storage. It's simple to install, simple to run, and simple to save on your bottom line.

Click here to see why the Seagate SSHD is the smart, affordable choice. WHY CHOOSE THE SEAGATE SOLID STATE HYBRID DRIVE?
Seagate SSHD is the smart, affordable choice for high-end laptops and workstations, high-performance gamer laptops, fast external enclosures using USB 3.0 or eSATA, and small form factor PCs. Seagate SSHD provides 4x faster performance than traditional 5400-RPM drives in PCMark Vantage benchmark scores, thanks in part to Adaptive Memory technology that optimizes as it learns your use patterns. It's compatible with any SATA-standard laptop PC and offers quiet operation without compromising storage capacity or affordability.

feature_bullets: Solid state hybrid drive delivers SSD-like performance with hard drive capacity options by storing most accessed data on 4 GB SLC SSD
Adaptive Memory technology customizes performance by aligning to user needs for overall improved system response
80 percent faster performance than traditional 7200-RPM drives in PCMark Vantage benchmark scores
Low heat and vibration - quiet operation without giving up storage capacity and affordability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars831 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
